abstract: A report from the World Bank focuses on the impact of violence on economic activity, and offers a prescription for how donor nations can help troubled countries.
snippet: A report from the World Bank focuses on the impact of violence on economic activity, and offers a prescription for how donor nations can help troubled countries.
lead_paragraph: When trying to rebuild a war-torn nation, focus first on security, not economic development. Then make a few highly visible improvements, like free health care for small children or restoring regular electricity. Also, hire female police officers.

headline.main: How to Rebuild a War-Torn Nation
